conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle in the magnetic field to determine magnetic induction B.
Particle is injected with velocity v0 at angle 45Â° to MN.
Vertical component of velocity is v0y = v0/sqrt(2).
Horizontal component of velocity is v0x = v0/sqrt(2).
Vertical component of velocity remains unchanged after collision.
Horizontal component reverses direction, new horizontal velocity is -v0/sqrt(2).
Particle undergoes circular motion due to magnetic force.
Radius R of circular path is given by qvB = mv^2/R.
Speed v of particle remains v0.
Particle travels 2d horizontally to reach point f.
Total horizontal distance traveled by particle is 4d.
Particle completes semicircle before hitting plate and another after collision to reach point f.
Total horizontal distance covered by particle is 2R.
Substitute R = 2d into radius formula: 2d = mv0/qB.
Magnitude of magnetic induction B is mv0/(2dq).
